<p style="color: green; font-size: 1.6em; font-weight: bold;">
Workshop 1: Data Wrangling and Data Visualizations in Health Data Science with R
</p>

<p style="color: red; font-size: 1.2em; font-weight: bold;">
One- Day Training Course Outline
</p>

<p style="color: black; font-size: 1.3em; font-weight: bold;">
Course Description
</p>

This hands-on course provides a comprehensive introduction to data manipulation and visualization using R, specifically tailored for health data science. Participants will learn essential skills for cleaning, transforming, and visualizing healthcare datasets including patient records, clinical trials, and public health data. Through practical exercises, attendees will gain proficiency in using R's Tidyverse ecosystem to derive insights from complex health data.

<p style="red: green; font-size: 1.2em; font-weight: bold;">
Course Prerequisites
</p>

-   Basic familiarity with R syntax and RStudio interface
-   Understanding of fundamental data types (vectors, data frames)

<p style="color: green; font-size: 1.2em; font-weight: bold;">
Course Outcomes
</p>

-   Clean and prepare messy health datasets for analysis
-   Perform advanced data transformations using dplyr and tidyr
-   Create publication-quality visualizations with ggplot2
-   Handle temporal health data and categorical variables effectively

<p style="color: green; font-size: 1.2em; font-weight: bold;">
Course Objectives
</p>

-   Master RStudio for health data analysis workflows
-   Develop strategies for handling missing values in medical datasets
-   Implement efficient data merging/joining techniques for multi-source health data
-   Create diagnostic visualizations for health metrics (blood pressure, age distributions, etc.)
-   Transform data between wide/long formats for different analytical needs
-   Generate time-series visualizations for patient monitoring and trend analysis
